abstract: Col Qalandar Shah Qalandari, Afghanistan’s most decorated pilot and commander of its fledgling air force, complains American supplied MD-530 scout helicopters are ‘total mess’ and inadequate for fighting Taliban; comments join previous gripes by other military officials who say American withdrawal leaves them ill-equipped in air power; American officials counter they are supplying best possible equipment, and sanctions prevent them from getting new parts and planes to supplement remnants of existing Russian manufactured fleet.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to build an effective air force began late, and, in the view of some Afghan officials, have gone nowhere, even as the Afghans fight the Taliban mostly alone.

headline.main: U.S. Is Struggling in Its Effort to Build an Afghan Air Force
headline.print_headline: Afghans Bemoan Disjointed Efforts to Build an Air Force

snippet: Efforts to build an effective air force began late, and, in the view of some Afghan officials, have gone nowhere, even as the Afghans fight the Taliban mostly alone.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
